1.text: Simon Peter, servant and sent of Jesus Christ, to them having received by inheritance equally honoured faith with us in the justice of our God and Saviour Jesus Christ:

2.text: May grace and peace be multiplied to you in the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,

3.text: As his divine power having bestowed upon us all things which for life and devotion, by the knowledge of him having called us by glory and fitness:

4.text: (By which the greatest and precious promises are bestowed upon us: that by these ye might be having escaped from the corruption in the world through eager desires.)

5.text: And also this same, having brought in at the side all earnestness, furnish in addition in your faith fitness; and In fitness knowledge;

6.text: And in knowledge self-control; and in self-control patience; and in patience devotion;

7.text: And in devotion brotherly love; and in brotherly love, love.

8.text: For these being to you, and abounding, they establish you not without effort, neither unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

9.text: For in whom these are not present, he is blind, being affected with shortness of sight, having taken forgetfulness of the cleansing formerly of his sins.

10.text: Wherefore rather, brethren, be earnest to have your calling and selection made firm: for doing these, ye should not once stumble:

11.text: For so shall an entrance be furnished richly to you in addition into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ.

12.text: Wherefore I will not neglect to remind you always of these things, though having known, and being supported in the present truth.

13.text: And I deem just, in as far as I am in this tent, to arouse you by putting in mind;

14.text: Knowing that the laying aside of my tent is swift; as also our Lord Jesus Christ manifested to me.

15.text: And I shall also be earnest for you always to have, after my exit, this putting in mind to be done.

16.text: For not having followed ingeniously contrived fictions, we made known to you the power and presence of our Lord Jesus Christ, but having been spectators of his majesty.

17.text: For having received from God the Father honour and glory, and such a voice brought to him from the magnificent glory, This is my dearly beloved Son, in whom I was contented.

18.text: And this voice brought from heaven we heard, being with him in the holy mountain.

19.text: And we have the prophetic word more firm; which holding to, ye do well, as to a light shining in a dusty place, even till the day shine through, and the morning star spring up in your hearts:

20.text: Knowing this first, that every prophecy of the writing is not of private solution.

21.text: For prophecy was not once brought by the will of man: but holy men of God spake, being moved by the Holy Spirit.
